info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 6:49PM MST until July 31 at 10:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 1000 PM MST. * At 649 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Temple Bar Campground, Pierce Ferry And Antares Roads, Meadview and Temple Bar. This includes the following roads... Temple Bar Road between mile markers 3 and 26. Pierce Ferry Road between mile markers 18 and 40. Stockton Hill Road between mile markers 39 and 43. Antares Road between mile markers 28 and 32. Diamond Bar Road between mile markers 1 and 2. This includes the following streams and drainages... Salt Spring Wash, Colorado River, White Elephant Wash, Cane Spring Wash, Fox Canyon Wash, Truxton Wash, Grapevine Wash, Trail Rapids Wash, Detrital Wash and Hualapai Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
